predictions.text: The U.S. 30-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS30) will close at or below 4.50% on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via FRED series DGS30 daily observation. Success if any closing value from 2025-11-02 through 2025-11-30 is ≤ 4.50%.
monitoring_signals: Term premium estimates and duration demand flows
predictions.rationale: Softening inflation and a more dovish rates backdrop can compress term premium and pull long-end yields lower at least once.

predictions.text: ICE BofA MOVE Index will close at or below 95.0 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the official ICE BofA MOVE Index end-of-day value from ICE Data Indices or equivalent market data vendor. Any close ≤ 95.0 between 2025-11-02 and 2025-11-30 counts.
predictions.rationale: A calmer inflation outlook and solid auction demand can suppress rates volatility at least temporarily.

predictions.text: Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) will close at or above 20.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm on Cboe VIX historical data. Success if any official daily close ≥ 20.00 in the period 2025-11-02 to 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Large SPX daily moves (±1.5% or more)
Macro event calendar (jobs, CPI, PPI, retail sales)
Oil price spikes and USD swings
predictions.rationale: Event risk, positioning, or an oil/FX shock can trigger a short-lived spike in equity implied volatility.

predictions.text: ICE Brent crude oil front-month futures will settle at or above $90.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use ICE official daily settlement for the front-month Brent contract. Any settlement ≥ $90.00 from 2025-11-02 through 2025-11-30 qualifies.
monitoring_signals: OPEC+ policy statements and JMMC outcomes
Large inventory draws in EIA weekly data
predictions.rationale: Potential OPEC+ extension and geopolitical risk provide upside tail risk to crude prices in November.

predictions.text: Ethereum (ETH-USD) will trade at or above $3,400 on at least one UTC day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via CoinMarketCap or a major exchange (Coinbase) daily high. Success if any UTC daily high ≥ $3,400 between 2025-11-02 and 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Spot ETF and fund flow data
Risk sentiment in equities and tech
predictions.rationale: Easier financial conditions and crypto beta can lift ETH to test higher resistance intra-month.

predictions.text: USD/CNH (CNH=X) will trade at or below 7.2500 on at least one UTC trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check Yahoo Finance (CNH=X) or Refinitiv intraday data. Success if intraday low ≤ 7.2500 on any UTC trading day from 2025-11-02 to 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: PBoC daily fix and policy guidance
predictions.rationale: A softer USD on dovish Fed expectations and intermittent PBoC support could allow a CNH relief rally.

predictions.text: The Conference Board Consumer Confidence Index for November 2025 will print between 97.0 and 104.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use The Conference Board’s official press release for November 2025. Success if the headline Consumer Confidence Index is ≥ 97.0 and ≤ 104.0.
monitoring_signals: Labor market differential (jobs plentiful vs hard-to-get)
Stock market performance and gas prices
predictions.rationale: Stabilizing labor views and temporary relief on benefits support a mid- to high-90s/low-100s reading.

predictions.text: U.S. Average Hourly Earnings (total private, MoM, SA) for October 2025 will print between +0.2% and +0.3% in the BLS Employment Situation report due 2025-11-07.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in the BLS Employment Situation news release Table B-3. Success if the total private Average Hourly Earnings month-over-month percent change is 0.2% or 0.3%.
predictions.rationale: Wage growth continues to cool gradually, with typical monthly prints clustering in the 0.2–0.3% range.

predictions.text: U.S. Producer Price Index excluding food and energy (core, MoM, SA) for October 2025 will print between +0.1% and +0.3%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via BLS PPI news release (Table showing Final Demand less foods and energy). Success if the October 2025 MoM percent change is 0.1%, 0.2%, or 0.3%.
monitoring_signals: Corporate earnings mentions of input costs
predictions.rationale: Pipeline price pressures look moderate with goods disinflation offset by steady services margins.

predictions.text: Atlanta Fed GDPNow nowcast for 2025 Q4 real GDP growth (SAAR) will print at or below 1.5% in at least one update by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check the Atlanta Fed GDPNow website updates between 2025-11-02 and 2025-11-30. Success if any published “Latest estimate” for 2025 Q4 SAAR is ≤ 1.5%.
monitoring_signals: Retail sales, industrial production, and construction data
Survey data (PMIs, ISM) feeding model inputs
predictions.rationale: Early-quarter data often leads GDPNow to mark down growth after strong prior-quarter prints.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, OPEC+ will announce an official extension of current voluntary oil production cuts into Q1 2026.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via OPEC.org official press release or communique. Success if the statement explicitly extends existing voluntary cuts at least through 2026 Q1.
monitoring_signals: Saudi and Russian energy ministry statements
OECD inventory levels and demand forecasts
predictions.rationale: Producers have incentives to defend prices amid demand uncertainty; policy continuity is likelier than relaxation.

predictions.text: AdvisorShares Pure US Cannabis ETF (MSOS) will close at or above $12.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Yahoo Finance MSOS historical prices. Success if the daily Close/Last price is ≥ $12.00 on any trading day between 2025-11-02 and 2025-11-30.
predictions.rationale: Policy optimism and momentum flows can extend the recent cannabis sector rally to new local highs.
